channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CAMEL-22219] Missing method list, emptyTrash and GenerateIds for Google Drive files
item.description:
Google Drive files is providing 13 methods https://camel.apache.org/components/4.10.x/google-drive-component.html#_api_drive-files and 3 are missing, it is all the ones which have no method parameter

(note that there should be a global query parameter usable but which is not passed as parameter of the method)
item.summary: Missing method list, emptyTrash and GenerateIds for Google Drive files

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
There are specific parameters for Google Drive files api generation in pom.xml (but do not know if causing the issues or not)
https://github.com/apache/camel/blob/main/components/camel-google/camel-google-drive/pom.xml#L187-L224

The genrated DriveFilesApiMethod contains the list method for instance https://github.com/apache/camel/blob/3a577f89dc9c51b8a303c7bc57f54319aa025169/components/camel-google/camel-google-drive/src/generated/java/org/apache/camel/component/google/drive/internal/DriveFilesApiMethod.java#L68

but not https://github.com/apache/camel/blob/main/components/camel-google/camel-google-drive/src/generated/java/org/apache/camel/component/google/drive/DriveFilesEndpointConfiguration.java
which is genrated using this Velocity template https://github.com/apache/camel/blob/main/tooling/maven/camel-api-component-maven-plugin/src/main/resources/api-endpoint-config.vm when i put a breakpoint the list method is in the context for the template

I tried to remove the specific configuration in the pom to see if it can influence it but it is failing too soon with:

�[1;31mError generating source for com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files: Argument [content] is used in multiple methods with different types com.google.api.services.drive.model.File, com.google.api.services.drive.model.ModifyLabelsRequest�[m

the list method is also missing on the Drives.Drives API (as opposition to Drives.Files)

https://camel.apache.org/components/4.10.x/google-drive-component.html#_api_drive-drives
https://developers.google.com/workspace/drive/api/reference/rest/v3/drives/list

in fact the ApiMethod is mentioned on https://github.com/apache/camel/blob/main/components/camel-google/camel-google-drive/src/generated/java/org/apache/camel/component/google/drive/DriveFilesEndpointConfiguration.java as an annotation of the class, (the lien is very long) 

@ApiMethod(methodName = "list", description="Lists the user's files", signatures={"com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$List list()"})

so sounds like the generation of this file is fine. Maybe more a problem on the generation of the catalog and documentation? (which would mean that we could write the URI and should work at runtime?)

I think the list method is missing from this file at this line:
https://github.com/apache/camel/blob/4eef3816d5760713699c5d6b6e345dba882e7169/components/camel-google/camel-google-drive/src/generated/resources/META-INF/org/apache/camel/component/google/drive/google-drive.json#L81

here is the formatted line:

{
    "consumerOnly": false,
    "producerOnly": false,
    "description": "The files collection of methods",
    "methods": {
        "copy": {
            "description": "Creates a copy of a file and applies any requested updates with patch semantics",
            "signatures": [
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$Copy copy(String fileId, com.google.api.services.drive.model.File content)"
            ]
        },
        "create": {
            "description": "Creates a new file",
            "signatures": [
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$Create create(com.google.api.services.drive.model.File content)",
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$Create create(com.google.api.services.drive.model.File content, com.google.api.client.http.AbstractInputStreamContent mediaContent)"
            ]
        },
        "delete": {
            "description": "Permanently deletes a file owned by the user without moving it to the trash",
            "signatures": [
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$Delete delete(String fileId)"
            ]
        },
        "download": {
            "description": "Downloads content of a file",
            "signatures": [
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$Download download(String fileId)"
            ]
        },
        "export": {
            "description": "Exports a Google Workspace document to the requested MIME type and returns exported byte content",
            "signatures": [
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$Export export(String fileId, String mimeType)"
            ]
        },
        "get": {
            "description": "Gets a file's metadata or content by ID",
            "signatures": [
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$Get get(String fileId)"
            ]
        },
        "listLabels": {
            "description": "Lists the labels on a file",
            "signatures": [
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$ListLabels listLabels(String fileId)"
            ]
        },
        "modifyLabels": {
            "description": "Modifies the set of labels applied to a file",
            "signatures": [
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$ModifyLabels modifyLabels(String fileId, com.google.api.services.drive.model.ModifyLabelsRequest content)"
            ]
        },
        "update": {
            "description": "Updates a file's metadata and\/or content",
            "signatures": [
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$Update update(String fileId, com.google.api.services.drive.model.File content)",
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$Update update(String fileId, com.google.api.services.drive.model.File content, com.google.api.client.http.AbstractInputStreamContent mediaContent)"
            ]
        },
        "watch": {
            "description": "Subscribes to changes to a file",
            "signatures": [
                "com.google.api.services.drive.Drive$Files$Watch watch(String fileId, com.google.api.services.drive.model.Channel content)"
            ]
        }
    }
}
Yes it works at runtime, but it seems that the json metadata does not include a few methods that has no args.
Okay so I found the problem is that the maven tooling that generates the metadata does not include methods with no parameters. I am adding this now (its a bit complex)
So its only in the documentation / json metadata. The methods are working at runtime. and it was also in camel-box, camel-zendesk and a few others as well

for reference, here is a branch (without moifications on the tests, neither the regen, neither the addition of a specific tests) https://github.com/apupier/camel/pull/new/investigateMissingGoogleAPI which has the advantage to add apis from a single place.

davsclaus have you looked to the query parameters mentioned here https://developers.google.com/workspace/drive/api/reference/rest/v3/drives/list and if they can be used in some ways? (there was the request fo rthe q parameter explictely)
You can try yourself by just adding q=cheese

the genric parameters for each Type of request are passed through specific setters and not from method parameters, for instance for Q method com.google.api.services.drive.Drive.Files.List.setQ(String) , I guess we would need a very specific handling of that in the Camel component

> try by just adding q=cheese

this is not working, the parameter is not recognized. but I was wondering if there were some specific alternatives like headers, or something else
Okay so looking in the code then this would require some special code to add support for q parameter.
reported https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CAMEL-22225 to handle the specific parameters
